Function: The CTLA4 gene regulates immune responses, including immune checkpoint modulation. In this melanoma study, while CTLA4 is not directly examined, immune checkpoint molecules like PD-1, PD-L1, and CTLA4 show differential expression in groups classified by a ferroptosis-related gene signature. This suggests a potential link between CTLA4, immune checkpoints, and ferroptosis pathways in melanoma progression and therapy.
Citation: Ping, S., Wang, S., Zhao, Y., He, J., Li, G., Li, D., Wei, Z., & Chen, J. (2022). Identification and validation of a ferroptosis-related gene signature for predicting survival in skin cutaneous melanoma. Cancer medicine, 11(18), 3529?3541. https://doi.org/10.1002/cam4.4706

Function: The A1CF gene regulates posttranscriptional ApoB mRNA editing and influences hepatic functions, including proliferation, lipogenesis, inflammation, and the development of hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC).
Citation: Blanc, V., Riordan, J. D., Soleymanjahi, S., Nadeau, J. H., Nalbantoglu, I., Xie, Y., Molitor, E. A., Madison, B. B., Brunt, E. M., Mills, J. C., Rubin, D. C., Ng, I. O., Ha, Y., Roberts, L. R., & Davidson, N. O. (2021). Apobec1 complementation factor overexpression promotes hepatic steatosis, fibrosis, and hepatocellular cancer. The Journal of clinical investigation, 131(1), e138699. https://doi.org/10.1172/JCI138699

Function: The A1CF gene is among nine RNA binding proteins (RBPs) identified as dysregulated in lung squamous cell carcinoma (LUSC). It plays a role in mRNA processes and has prognostic value for LUSC outcomes.
Citation: Li, W., Li, X., Gao, L. N., & You, C. G. (2020). Integrated Analysis of the Functions and Prognostic Values of RNA Binding Proteins in Lung Squamous Cell Carcinoma. Frontiers in genetics, 11, 185. https://doi.org/10.3389/fgene.2020.00185
